001/**
002 * This is the login page controller 
003 * @author Sarah Higdon
004 */
005package src.controller;
006
007import javafx.fxml.FXML;
008import javafx.fxml.FXMLLoader;
009import javafx.scene.Parent;
010import javafx.scene.Scene;
011import javafx.scene.image.ImageView;
012import javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent;
013import javafx.stage.Stage;
014import src.controller.useful_functions.user_role;
015import javafx.scene.Node;
016
017import static src.controller.useful_functions.current_user_role;
018import static src.controller.useful_functions.switch_scene;
019
020import java.io.File;
021import java.io.IOException;
022// if this all is highlighted red its okay because vscode cant see JavaFX at compile time
023// this is what the launch.json file is for in the .vscode folder
024    //this is resolved at runtime
025public class login_page_controller {
026
027    @FXML
028    private ImageView manager_button;
029
030    @FXML
031    private ImageView cashier_button;
032
033    /**
034     * This function opens the manger GUI when manager button is clicked
035     * @param event - Manager button getting clicker
036     */
037    @FXML
038    private void handle_manager_click(MouseEvent event) {
039        current_user_role = user_role.MANAGER;
040        System.out.println("user role set to MANAGER");
041        //this function comes from useful_functions.java
042        switch_scene("GUI/manager_view.fxml", event);
043    }
044
045    /**
046     * This function opens the cashier GUI when cashier button is clicked
047     * @param event - Cashier button getting clicker
048     */
049    @FXML
050    private void handle_cashier_click(MouseEvent event) {
051        current_user_role = user_role.CASHIER;
052        System.out.println("user role set to CASHIER");
053        switch_scene("GUI/order_page.fxml", event);
054    }
055
056    /**
057     * This function just prints out a message to console to say eveything loaded correctly
058     */
059    @FXML
060    public void initialize() {
061        //can delete this method if not needed
062        System.out.println("Login page loaded successfully!");
063    }
064
065
066}
